article:
This is a list of '[[National Historic Sites of Canada]]' () in '[[Montreal]]',
Quebec and surrounding municipalities on the Island of Montreal. There are 59
National Historic Sites in this region, The National Historic Sites on the
Island of Montreal are listed in the
[http://www.pc.gc.ca/apps/dfhd/default_eng.aspx Directory of Federal Heritage
Designations] under the following locations: MontrÃ©al, Lachine, Mont-Royal, Sainte-Anne-de-
Bellevue and Senneville. of which four (Lachine Canal, Louis-Joseph
Papineau, Sir George-Ãtienne Cartier and The Fur Trade at Lachine National
Historic Site) are administered by Parks Canada. ;  The site of the
village of Hochelaga was designated in 1920, and was the first site designated
in Montreal.

National Historic Sites located elsewhere in Quebec are listed at List of
National Historic Sites of Canada in Quebec.

This list uses names designated by the Historic Sites and Monuments Board of
Canada, which may differ from other names for these sites.
